website_summaries.verdict: The WD Blue is a decent SSD that may be worth the investment when the price comes down.
pros: The WD Blue SSD is faster than any regular hard drive and you can write a ton of data to it before it wears out
cons: The drive is expensive and doesn't justify the added cost

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for my needs, it doubled the performance of a very slow PC
customer_reviews.text: Drive works perfectly. In fact, it doubled the performance of a very unimpressive cheap PC. For the longest time I could barely stand to use the PC that this drive went into. But now, while it's not a top shelf speed demon by any means, it is much more tolerable to use.
customer_reviews.author: C Homrich Jr.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: New life for old machines
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these to bring new life to a couple of old laptops. Kept my old operating systems and cloned & partitioned them for Linux Mint as a second system using the free version of Minitool. Both laptops work perfect with this drive and the newer one with a faster interface & CPU runs at least 5 times faster than with its old mechanical drive. They barely get warm and I haven't had a computer freeze or blue screen since installing them. They will probably outlive the machines I put them in so when that time comes, they will be re-purposed to another machine.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good mainstream SSD.
customer_reviews.text: This is a product of WD's acquisition of SanDisk. Overall, this is a great mainstream SSD. While there are slightly faster ones to be had for quite a bit more money in everyday use for most people you wouldn't be able to tell the difference. Still a massive improvement over a rotating mechanical hard drive - this made my ThinkPad T430 go from a total dog (yay 5400RPM laptop hard drives) to nearly as fast as my Core i7 gaming/workstation laptop. So far this SSD has handled everything I've thrown at it just fine - everything from simple stuff like browsing the internet to heavy virtualization workloads! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: shovenose

customer_reviews.title: No more waiting for Windows desktop to load after boot!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is fast booting. This drive fixes one of my pet peeves after getting in to Windows sitting there for 2 mins for icons etc to load. Now it is secs not mins, It works flawless in Windows 10. I got this after my Acer V3-731 hard drive died. I was able to restore using Acer software I ordered off their site and got back up and running in a couple hours UPDATE:.I notice after 4 month when I download the WD Dashboard software that on my Acer laptop the the WD drive is at 99%. If I lose a % every 4 month this sucker s going to last a long time. This is still the best upgrade ever.
customer_reviews.author: Randall D. Lind

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 2 years with minimal use, WD not honoring warranty
customer_reviews.text: Drive was installed as a secondary drive (non OS) in a secondary computer. It failed in less then two years. None of my computers will boot with it installed. What's worse - when I go to the website to try to register it (necessary to ask a question or create an RMA), I get an error saying "failed to register: because it’s either an OEM product or the warranty has been voided." The drive was purchased from Amazon (not a third party seller) and it came in a retail box. Very disappointed with Western Digital. I have SSD's that are much older and used more frequently, still working today.
customer_reviews.author: JohnM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drive for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drive for the money! Setup was a breeze using Macrium Reflect software to clone my drive (not included but they offer a free edition for home users). Windows 10 started without any issues at all. The speed is excellent compared to a standard hard disk. A few things to be aware of however: this drive does not include a SATA cable, power adapter, or mounting tray. Check to make sure if you need those first before ordering. Otherwise this is a perfect choice for those upgrading to an SSD and cannot afford a more expensive Samsung drive.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Kie

customer_reviews.title: An essential part of a computer build (does not come with a 2.5" adapter)
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent upgrade from a traditional hard drive. I now have my operating system and important software on this SSD, and my games and other non-essentials on a 1TB HHD. My system now boots up in 15-20 seconds (previously 1.5-2 minutes on my HHD), from BIOS (Quick Boot disabled) to login (Windows 10). It would boot much faster if I still weren't using my Q9650 processor (nine years old and still kicking!). Depending on your computer, you might need a 2.5" adapter to make this fit, if you don't already have a spot for it.
customer_reviews.author: Skayruggs

customer_reviews.title: Value, good support software.  Perfect SSD
customer_reviews.text: I've install a couple of these WD Blue SSDs as an alternative to Samsung (I fix computers). I've used Kingston (failed), OWC, Sandisk, and Samsung SSDs. The WD is a great value and just worked. It's fast. Don't forget to go to their support website to get the free copy of Acronis to clone your drive, and the SSD Dashboard to set up Trim.
customer_reviews.author: desert techie

customer_reviews.title: Defective SSD received, but warranty honored quickly
customer_reviews.text: This product was pretty much defective from the get go, but it was impossible to troubleshoot. I kept replacing other parts on my computer, because it was randomly crashing. This product cost me a lot of time, money and data. I lost 20 years worth of personal computer data, because I hadn’t backed up my SSD onto another hard drive. Although western digital quickly honored the warranty via a replacement. I probably spent close to $500 replacing other computer parts and wasted several days troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Douglas

customer_reviews.title: WD = Reliability
customer_reviews.text: What do you say about a hard drive? It works or it doesn't. This drive went into my new computer build as my system drive and has performed perfectly. My system boots and loads very quickly. I bought Western Digital for 3 reasons - their reputation, past experience with WD drives and their warranty. The WD SSD Dashboard software gives detailed information about the status of your drive and lots of additional information. I always recommend Western Digital drives because of their reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad McEachern

customer_reviews.title: State-of-the-Art for Your Old-timey PC!
customer_reviews.text: When I got this hard-drive, it looked so small, I almost felt cheated, but it's a real-deal 500GB hard drive that's super fast and far more reliable than a standard unit, since it's solid state. I tried to get a frame that I could use in my PC's (FX 6800) removable-drive-bay PC, but couldn't get one that positioned the drive correctly. Thankfully, it's so small and light, it plugs into the port and sits there without strain. It's easy to format and works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: T. H. Pine

customer_reviews.title: FAST.
customer_reviews.text: Performance is great. Blows away the Patriot SSD I had before. Only thing worth more to me would be to get a large Samsung EVO SSD. If you're a novice linux user, make sure you have noatime as a FSTAB option. It makes a world of a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This SS drive alone sped my laptop up from a 45 second startup to a 8 second startup. I see similar speed increases on all of my installed programs. Afterward I added 4gb of RAM just to ward off any slowdowns once loaded. It's a great way to update an older laptop. Be careful though, the speed increase will spoil you.
customer_reviews.author: DeanT

customer_reviews.title: Great Speed Increase
customer_reviews.text: Used SuperDuper software to copy to this disk from the original internal disk on my wife's MacBook Pro, I put ithis disk aim a USB inclosure that I had to copy to it. Then swapped the two disk. She has been very happy with the speed increase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic SSD for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a boot drive for my OS because my computer was experiencing micro-stuttering and very slow start-up times (symptoms of a failing hard-drive). I purchased a separate SSHD for the rest of my files and programs. My computer starts up in seconds now, and the applications that I saved onto it besides the OS (such as Skype) open instantly. Files transfer ridiculously fast compared to my old hard drive as well. Needless to say this SSD fixed the issues I was having. I will update this review if the drive fails, but so far it's performing really well!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Works great! As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no problems! After downloading the clone software, I plugged the SSD into second SATA and power cable and it took about 30 minutes to clone my 500 GB hard drive. No SATA-USB cable needed. My company bought me a Samsung EVO 850 SSD which DID require a SATA-USB cable to clone. It took over 6 hours to clone my 500GB hard disk.
customer_reviews.author: RAF

customer_reviews.title: Good price but better alternatives available
customer_reviews.text: Not 500gb, only got 446gb after formatting. Not the fastest sata SSD but easier to install than a traditional SSD drive. Samsung's SSD is faster but a bit more money. You won't see a difference in gaming or program loading but, when transferring multiple folders/files from one SSD or high speed server you will notice a difference. I use this primarily for games but for file transferring there are better options.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I installed it last night without a problem. I used EaseUS Todo Backup Free's System Clone function to copy my 160GB HDD to the WD 250GB SSD. This left an unused partition that I expanded using Windows Disk Manager, but I did not expand it until I was sure my PC was going to boot from the SSD properly. After copying, I shut down my PC and removed the old hard drive just to make sure it would boot from the new drive. The PC booted up much faster and quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! The reviews are correct. Very noticeable speed increase on my older Dell Optiplex 760. The old hard drive was a 1TB 7200rpm Seagate that I bought just after the 1TB drives came out so its older. When transferring big files (2GB+) from the old Seagate to my NAS I would see a peak of 39MB/sec but that speed would vary a lot. With the new SSD drive I see about 112MB/sec and the transfer speed is constant.
customer_reviews.author: Ristin

customer_reviews.title: Great boot drive
customer_reviews.text: Using this as a boot drive for a new Ryzen build. MB read it first try, loaded windows 10 on it and away I went. From power button to having comodo open to its homepage is just under 20 seconds. I think I can cut that down as well since I am only running 8gb of ddr4-2400 and I've heard that my MB runs a memory test every boot up that can be disabled. Bought many WD products in the past and trust them with my data storage needs. This is cheaper than the Samsung ones out there but just as fast. Fast enough for gaming or whatever your needs are.
customer_reviews.author: Caffeine Addict

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital makes the best products when it comes to storage
customer_reviews.text: Just added this 500GB WD Blue SSD to my custom build - a no-brainer really. Currently on my 2nd custom PC and it has (1) 4TB WD Black, (1) 500GB WD Blue, and (5) 4TB WD Reds. Western Digital makes the best products when it comes to storage. I've used WD products in my 2 custom PCs I've built. First computer I kept for 5 years with ZERO HDD or SSD issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jamarryan

customer_reviews.title: Can't say how happy I am I
customer_reviews.text: I'm limited to SATA II on my P5K-premium-WIfI/AP, but just because IOPs (coming from a HDD)...Can't say how happy I am I!!!. I'll write back once this little sh!t gets dirty and/or wears out. Fedora 26/Ubuntu beta 17.10 (yes, swap partition{shared}) , and kvm/qemu win/lin machines on it! Boot times (from HDD) are 100:1 and vm's response times close to 20:1! (!!!)
customer_reviews.author: Marco P.

customer_reviews.title: Wicked Fast
customer_reviews.text: I just replaced my Macbook Pro Mid-2012 HDD with this SDD. My macbook is now running at least twice as fast, perhaps faster. I'm now looking into another for my other computer. This is really worth it! FYI - I needed to also run the disk utility first aid and reset PRAM to get everything synced up right, but that takes only about 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: OrangeFlower

customer_reviews.title: It's stupidly fast, but has a minor stability issue.
customer_reviews.text: Great little drive. I love how fast it is. However, there is a problem with my system freezing that doesn't happen with my other m.2 drive. Not sure if I just happened to find the one drive that would have a minor stability issue. It's still working and hasn't failed, but the next m.2 I buy will be of a higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Good drive, fast, working fine so far.
customer_reviews.text: Working fine so far. I had trouble trying to make an image of a 500gb hard drive to a 250 gb. ssd since only 100gb was in use. Found out that you need to shrink the hard drive so that it showed less than 250gb, but that was not possible, so I bought this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Davey Jones

customer_reviews.title: Save some money and get the WD!
customer_reviews.text: I ended up narrowing it down to this drive and a Samsung EVO of the same size. This drive is obviously a lot cheaper, and I think it runs blazing fast. I don't have any fancy graphics or any speed comparisons to show anyone, but I'm definitely happy I got this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Complete Failure within 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Western Digital product for its reliability, so much for that. Complete failure within 18 months. PC does not even recognize it is attached. Worked fine one day & did not boot the next. I used this as an extra HD to store documents/files while my main drive did the regular processing. Hopefully I can get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: vtouch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: After copying my old hard drive data to this drive, it installed easily in my Lenovo laptop. I now get thrilling performance for all of my applications. By Windows 10 boot time went from minutes to 3.5 seconds. Love the product!
customer_reviews.author: music-lover

customer_reviews.title: This was a great value and it's clear to see this is the ...
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy another HDD after seeing how fast these SSDs are. This was a great value and it's clear to see this is the future. This was a fantastic replacement for my 1TB HDD. Make sure you understand how to clone hard drives, because the package only contains the hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hard drive very fast and easy to fix
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hard drive very fast and easy to fix. Comes with some software to help clone another drive.... But you do need to setup the drive and format it using disk management.
customer_reviews.author: Rishme Sheriff

customer_reviews.title: Western Digital has been one of my favorite brands for the last 20 years
customer_reviews.text: Been wanting to upgrade the storage capacity on my PC for some time now. Just waiting for prices to come down a bit. Western Digital has been one of my favorite brands for the last 20 years. They make quality stuff and I knew this would be too. Of course I was not let down. My new 500gb SSD is amazingly fast and soundless! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: StarDude Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: Immediate improvement, so far I'm loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a nice all-in-one 24-inch family PC. However, it has been struggling because of a poor spinning disk hard drive. I cloned the hard drive to the SSD and replaced it without a hitch. The PC is probably 10 to 20 times faster, especially from boot to doing something productive. Used to be on a restart it would take roughly 5 minutes before I could do something as simple as open a browser window. Now it is a 10-second restart, and I am immediately able to launch Chrome, and it opens fast! I do not have any comments on long term durability, but out-of-the-box it is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Richard O.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fast and stable.
customer_reviews.text: So far this drive has worked well and is fast as a boot and programs drive. I had to reinstall windows 10 and my programs on it from my mechanical because cloning would not work, but I think that is my computer manufacturer's shortsightedness that made it difficult. Since I'm retired, I didn't mind having to do all the install work again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R

customer_reviews.title: I'm getting an average of only 166. 4 MB/s ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting an average of only 166.4 MB/s out of this drive right now, however I put it into an aged Gateway NV44 that uses DDR2 PC6400, with a slower SATA 3Gb/s header & a T4300 processor that is not a power house. Start times are much faster, making for a more responsive system despite the older interfaces & slower memory.
customer_reviews.author: John Bruell

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: High quality and super fast SSD. I love having lots of space on my laptop so this was a must upgrade. In case anyone is searching the answer, this M.2 2280 is both B and M-keyed. This ensures capability with any M.2 2280 slot. My laptop had an M.2 SSD with only an M-key -- this Western Digital SSD fits and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: jbv

customer_reviews.title: Great drive
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this, has been rock solid since I installed it. Was able to easily copy over my old filesystem to it, and convert the old one to extra storage. Has been my primary driver for a number of months and couldn't be happier. Just make sure your board supports the length.
customer_reviews.author: P. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good m.2 slightly difficult install
customer_reviews.text: A lot smaller than I thought but it was a pain to install because it kept on popping up I had to hold it down and I knew that big data screwdriver to get to screw into the Hall wasn't awful but it was still difficult it continues to work this day at maximum performance so far not letting me down
customer_reviews.author: Apollo Smile

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Rapid, Reliable
customer_reviews.text: One of the best replacement hard drives. The solid state 1Terrabyte is a huge storage monster, and greatly improves the speed of your computer. Adding this has given my seven year old laptop a new life.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bunting

customer_reviews.title: Amazing M.2 Drive
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't optimistic about this drive because of the price, especially compared to similar drives from Samsung, but I have been very pleased. My PC usually boots to the Desktop in about 5 seconds, files read and write very fast, and this is overall a great drive. It's not as fast as comparable Samsung EVO or PRO M.2 drives, but also about 1/5 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnar

customer_reviews.title: Having this SSD makes you're PC so much better! My dad was complaining about how slow his ...
customer_reviews.text: Having this SSD makes you're PC so much better! My dad was complaining about how slow his PC starts up. After I install his window and did everything, there wasn't anymore uttering and complaining about his computer from him anymore! A much have even though it's not necessarily because you can just use your HDD.
customer_reviews.author: teev

customer_reviews.title: Holy NICE!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! One TB of M.2 for this price? Why wouldn't you? My system boots in about 23 to 25 seconds, and I literally need no other drive on my system. The speed and ease make it well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: KnitePrince

customer_reviews.title: WD SSD Good vibes.
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long? ease of installation, less heat in the box, and super quiet. I'd recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Minnard

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love SSD, even if they wear out before standard HD
customer_reviews.text: Be sure you have a cable and adapter plate because they aren't included. Will update if it fails too soon. Go download MiniTool Partition Wizard, it's free, especially if this is larger than your old drive and backup image. You do have a backup image, right? Oh, that reminds me, I gotta run back ups now, bye.
customer_reviews.author: Lew Stewal

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective, works fine
customer_reviews.text: It works just fine. Boot time is comparable, or maybe a little quicker, than the Crucial m.2 SSD it replaced. I am hoping for more than two years of service out of this WD drive versus the Crucial.
customer_reviews.author: kalvinr11

customer_reviews.title: A MacBook Pro mid-2012 LIFE SAVER
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace the original hard drive in my MacBook Pro mid 2012. It operates completely as it should. My Mac still runs like new and she’s nearly a decade old. I bought this hard drive in 2016. So it’s three years later and everything is still great.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Good Value and FAST
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly fast. It turned my 2012 Macbook Pro 13 into a speed demon....as fast or faster than the current 2017 models. Where the computer used to boot in about 50 seconds to a minute, with this drive the computer starts and loads everything in 10-15 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Xesez

customer_reviews.title: WARNING. DO NOT PURCHASE. RECEIVED COUNTERFEIT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this almost two years ago, however, it lasted only a week before permanently blue screening my brand new $1200+ custom build desktop. I had been building this thing one piece at a time for almost four years because I'm rather poor. This was my baby. And it died. It wasn't until recently I was able to afford the $500 repair cost, and I just received word from the computer repair tech that my SSD was a counterfeit. May have worked for some people, but trust me. It's not worth the risk. Learn from my mistake, don't buy computer parts from a 3rd party, even Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Lightning fast speed!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, changed my sluggish Lenova laptop into a very fast device. I was ready to replace it, bought this installed easily and now my Laptop is very fast. Highly recommend this for replacing standard hard drives
customer_reviews.author: Gary H

customer_reviews.title: Built to last (and cheap)
customer_reviews.text: Had no issues over 2 years, runs the OS very quickly. Be sure to check if your MOBO supports M.2 as those are even faster and more advanced than SSD but this price is sure hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I have no complaints about this item
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have no complaints about this item. It's fast, as was advertised, and easy to install as well as being sold at a reasonable price compared to some others. I would definitely buy again a WD BLUE SSD.
customer_reviews.author: fhrodrig

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD Drive
customer_reviews.text: works great!! Replaced a 64GB SSD drive with this. Running windows 10. HUGE difference in responsiveness of PC. This was my third attempt at upgrading this HD. The other two resulted in returning the larger SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Wrath

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased mostly SanDisk SSD drives in the past and decided to try the Western Digital SSD model this time. It has worked great for the past 6 months and I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: FBS-Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.text: Just what the doctor ordered! This SSD along with a RAM upgrade from 4 GB to 8 GB gave my older 15" MacBook Pro (Early 2011) new life. Boot time went from nearly 3 minutes (2 min 45 sec to be exact) to 22 seconds flat. Laptop runs like a completely new machine now.
customer_reviews.author: djamiol

customer_reviews.title: Very nice SSD for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy so far with this product. I used this to rebuild a computer that had crashed. I placed this drive as the main drive holding the operating system (Win 10 Pro 64 bit) So far boot times are outstanding. Has been operating very stable. No issues to speak of. Planing on getting another to upgrade an older laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Little

customer_reviews.title: The software recommended to copy the operating system over didn't work and ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my HP Pavilion so I could put my operating system on it. The software recommended to copy the operating system over didn't work and ultimately I had to erase my my original hard drive, install the operating system on the SSD, and reinstall all my other program on whichever drive I wanted. Start up is now is about 30 seconds or less. Working well after a month.
customer_reviews.author: The House

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Totally satisfied with my purchase. Running win7 in an overclocked xeon machine and replaced a faulty os drive with this ssd. What a difference! Will buy another and replace the data drive.
customer_reviews.author: Paratus

customer_reviews.title: Good SSD for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good SSD for the price. Unless you are doing very specific task I wouldn't get to hung up on benchmarked speed. I have Linux on this WD SSD and on a Samsung 850 and I often forget which one is which.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Quick little thing.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work great. I keep my OS and a few little apps on it and it's been super fast to boot up and run. Only thing that's a little lame is it doesn't fit any mounts for my computer case so it's just kinda floating in there.
customer_reviews.author: IcarusGen2

customer_reviews.title: the perfect upgrade for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: helped rejuvenate my aging computer! Been up and running now for a while with no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great SSD.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic SSD. Took my 2 TB out which was way slow and did not need that much space and this hooked up to my existing carriage in my new Dell and now boot time is 30 sec's. Running even better than before. Everything is so much quicker. The cloning software from WD worked perfectly and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: This was purchased to replace a 500GB mechanical where only ...
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace a 500GB mechanical where only 100GB was being used. It does the job just as it should - Windows 10 OS boots in about 3seconds, and programs and applications open fast. I don't have benchmarks, but real world shows it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan N.

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution to replace the small 256Gb SSD in my new Dell Inspiron PC. It works great so far and I love it. Only problem is that the specs still reads 256Gb.
customer_reviews.author: John LMan

customer_reviews.title: A perfect Windows 10 companion
customer_reviews.text: These drives are some of the fastest SSD's I've ever used. I'm a SANDisk follower, but the performance of these feels faster.
customer_reviews.author: Dad in Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Great speed!
customer_reviews.text: Gotta love SSD. This is the fastest Windows has ever booted. In fact, I have a Linux Mint install on a Sandisk Extreme flash drive and it has always booted faster than Windows. Finally Windows boots (almost) as fast as my Mint stick.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A solid choice.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the reputation and price. This turned an old Intel G31 Express system from a clunker into a champ.
customer_reviews.author: buk_reader

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Good value for money. Now I can finally use my windows 10 computer without waiting forever for things to settle down. A little slower than expected when doing intensive seek operations. However, lightning fast moving large chunks of data. Overall a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This drive offers very good performance, for a pretty sharp price. It is one of the cheaper 250GB drives on the market (was when I purchased it) but has performed flawlessly so far. Especially good value for laptops where it will save weight and battery life as well as increase speed.
customer_reviews.author: RLP1999

customer_reviews.title: I will get some more time with my trusty old ...
customer_reviews.text: I will get some more time with my trusty old Toshiba laptop after installing this drive and doubling the ram. Obviously the drive is faster than the old HDD, but what impressed me as well, was the increase in battery life.
customer_reviews.author: riorust

customer_reviews.title: Didn't die but ran strangely since day 1. Speeds ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't die but ran strangely since day 1. Speeds were as fast as a disc drive. Programs crashed or wouldn't load.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Tried cloning using he recommended WD clone tool and it worked but several things ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried cloning using he recommended WD clone tool and it worked but several things in windows were not working, tried to restore from recovers usb I had created and tried it again and it is not copying the information over. Cannot get the drive to boot to windows anymore on the SSD, glad I didn't destroy the old drive.
customer_reviews.author: Leftwingre6785

customer_reviews.title: So Far I am happy with the operation of the new drive
customer_reviews.text: My Hitachi operating hard drive on my 12 year old Gateway crashed .. replaced it with his WD Blue SSD (restored from Acronis). So Far I am happy with the operation of the new drive ... will have to see if it will last as long as the original drive did..
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Bryza

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Easy to install, great speed boost to aging Macs. *Note: you do NOT need the mounting bracket kit for Macbook Pros, this fits perfectly into the existing HD slot.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Bush

customer_reviews.title: The SSD was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The SSD was easy to install, but the recommended transfer software did not work with Windows 10, I want to thank Macrium Reflect for the freeware that worked. It transferred my OS to the SSD with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stinnett

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 year and 7 months of use and the disk doesn't work anymore
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on may 2017 and 2 weeks ago the disk stopped working altogether. While it was working it was a great disk but I'm never buying another WD SSD after this. Now I have a dead SSD that western digital won't replace because I bought it while I was living in the US and now I'm living in Argentina.
customer_reviews.author: Guido Nicolás

customer_reviews.title: I chose WD because I've always had excellent results from their drives
customer_reviews.text: The jury is out on this SSD. This drive replaced a 250G SSD that failed (unexpectedly) in < 2 years. THAT drive was from a name brand memory manufacturer. I went back to an SSD because of the speed. I chose WD because I've always had excellent results from their drives. If it lasts beyond the 3 year warranty period, I'll be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Shemchak

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Put one in an older win7 laptop and it transformed it into something very useful. very significant increase in performance
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Dilke

customer_reviews.title: Fast drive!
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. I put it in a desktop computer. Love the fast boot. After using this drive, I don't think I'll ever go back to the non solid state versions. They run like molasses in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Lightfoot

customer_reviews.title: wish I had it since it was possible to buy it!
customer_reviews.text: it's almost unreal how fast my laptop runs now, wish I had it since it was possible to buy it! and it's helped me get more organized with my files, as I now have to keep all my big files (mainly backups, and some video files) on the hard drive this replaced
customer_reviews.author: El David Cordero.

customer_reviews.title: WD SSD much faster then the original Samsung SATA Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: This WD SSD worked great in my DELL Inspiron 3543 as a replacement for a failing hard drive. It is MUCH faster than the original Samsung SATA hard drive. Windows boot up, program openings & file transfers are much faster. It was easy to swap out.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S

customer_reviews.title: great drive
customer_reviews.text: finally came down to a reasonable price point. great drive and WAY better that standard drive. There is no comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for slow laptop
customer_reviews.text: Replaced existing mechanical drive with the SSD on my older Acer Aspire One. Windows 10 and programs load faster. Overall the laptop is now more usable when traveling. This was a good upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: CalPAF

customer_reviews.title: My PC now boots in seconds rather than 5 minutes and it is super fast now thanks to this reliable Western Digital solid ...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded by 2010 Sony VAIO laptop with this SSD. I cloned my old HDD and installed the new SSD. My PC now boots in seconds rather than 5 minutes and it is super fast now thanks to this reliable Western Digital solid state drive.
customer_reviews.author: Thaddius Mumford

customer_reviews.title: Best Upgrade EVER!
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? Your computer will run twice (or more) as fast, cloning software (downloaded from WD website) was quick and easy, installation on my Dell Inspiron One was simple and only took a 1/2 hour to complete, quiet operation and works with less power. Rebooted with no hitch. Just remember to buy a USB 3.0 to 2.5" SATA III Hard Drive connector with the SSD as you will need this to clone your drive. Super product ... well done WD!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Schwan

customer_reviews.title: A great SSD for long-term storage.
customer_reviews.text: You almost don't need to review this SSD. I use it in my this drive as my tank in my MSI GE72 7RD Apache laptop. Reliable and stable. It's not the fastest drive out there but I use it as fast storage.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew A.

customer_reviews.title: To get what you order!
customer_reviews.text: Since I bought it over a year ago, now there is something wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Air Chopper

customer_reviews.title: Wish it came with better software for cloning
customer_reviews.text: Wish it came with better software for cloning. I had to end up using 3rd party after hassle of trying to use theirs.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph - Metro Manila

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from a slow-as-molasses 128GB SSD that came installed with ...
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a slow-as-molasses 128GB SSD that came installed with the Lenovo Yoga 2 11" laptop. As a result, performance and response is desktop-like with extra capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Phuong Ta

customer_reviews.title: Very good as a boot drive and for a few games
customer_reviews.text: Very good as a boot drive and for a few games. Loads very fast although transfer speeds can be a bit slow compared to other SSDs. However, if you only need a boot drive or a drive for games and are not worrying about heavy content creation, then this drive is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Anzel Arce

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a storage-only device, not a boot device. But for me it's been very fast to read and write. I store photo and video files on it and there's no lag or slowness of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: L. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: An easy upgrade for any laptop or desktop.
customer_reviews.text: Thefrom Western Digital performed great. I had it installed in a 2011 MacBook Pro 15" Laptop as an upgrade to the 5400 RPM OEM drive. It performed great and still holds up
customer_reviews.author: NegroISO

customer_reviews.title: Get This Instead of New Computer!
customer_reviews.text: Used this drive to replace the 5400rpm hard drive in my 4 year old laptop. Easy install and works beautifully (once the OS and software are all installed). Made this computer run extremely fast...like a brand new computer!!!
customer_reviews.author: IvoryDawg

customer_reviews.title: Great product - used it to replace the 128GB drive ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product - used it to replace the 128GB drive supplied with my Asus N752VX notebook PC. Tried to use the WD backup software (Acronis) but could not get it to partition the 500GB as one drive. Finally used ToDo backup and this partitioned the drive as required. I have been using the drive now for about a month and am completely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It what I would expect from WD. No problems just works and is as fast as advertized.
customer_reviews.author: DonL

customer_reviews.title: 5 year old laptop is now a rocket!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to clone my hard drive, switch it out in laptop... then I took out the DVD and slapped another in it's place... laptop is lightning fast -faster than anything I've ever had -has made my aging HP G4 2.8 Ghz with 8 gig ram feel like s brand new computer.... best practical tweak I've done -sorry I waited this long!
customer_reviews.author: Dr James Pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Boot Time improve now Just Half compare to Segate SSHD. Never see read write speed abobe 300Mbps.
customer_reviews.text: I never see the speed of read and write above 300 Mbps while copy & Paste file from another Samsung SSD. But the laptop booting speed improve compare to my Previous 1Tb SSHD. Now the boot time is just half then SSHD.
customer_reviews.author: Ashu

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Awesome SSD
customer_reviews.text: Crazy Awesome SSD - I was about to give up on my 2012 macbook pro and i put this monster in it and it's like new... It's crazy fast and runs programs like a boss... Good buy
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Installed great in laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Came with needed accessories/software to install. Note that I had to download the software from WD site.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Geeks!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well ... but, fair warning to computer neophytes ... it is very difficult to change out your active boot drive ... this is only for computer experts or geeks with lots of determination and patience.
customer_reviews.author: Dilux Gee' n Gee

customer_reviews.title: Good SSD for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just received the SSD and I couldn't be any happier. Honestly a good hard drive for the price but It's not as fast as the samsung SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Hash

customer_reviews.title: SSD turns your slow old and new laptops in to faster machines.
customer_reviews.text: turns a slow booting laptop to a super quick booting laptop. Even once it's booted up it performs so much better than the stock laptop with slow HDD. I'm always pleased with these types of drives.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Cunningham

product_meta.title: WD Blue Solid State Drive
product_meta.description: Capacity:250GB| Style:2D NAND 2.5” SSDWith superior performance and a leader in reliability, the WD Blue SSD offers digital storage that is optimized for multi-tasking and ready to keep up with your high performance computing needs. Available in both 2.5"/7mm cased and M.2 2280 form factors and WD's Functional Integrity Testing Lab (FIT Lab), the WD Blue SSD is compatible with a wide range of computers, so you can be sure you are making the right choice. Combined with the free, downloadable WD SSD Dashboard and a 3-year limited warranty, you can confidently upgrade your system to the WD Blue SSD.
feature_bullets: Sequential read speeds of up to 545MB/s and sequential write speeds of up to 525MB/s
An industry leading 1.75M hours Mean Time To Failure (MTTF) and several error correction technologies for lasting reliability
Optimized for multitasking to simultaneously run resource heavy applications without system slow down
Available in 2.5 inch/7millimeter and M.2 2280 models to accommodate most PCs
WD FIT Lab certification for compatibility across a wide range of laptop and desktop computers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,815 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
